name: Sound Toy 002 -- Pixelated Noise
description: You can "pixelate" sound by flattening adjacent values in the raw audio signal. When white noise is pixelated, high frequencies drop out and latent undertones emerge. Tap or draw to change the board. Red and pink control pixelation size and variance. Orange controls smoothing. Lower left buttons activate three autoplay modes: relaxed, active, and geometric. Drag and release the lower right button to randomize the board. Tap outside the board to mute. Idlebit, 2021.
